comments.body:
If you don't know how to get or what a Structure Block is, you can get it by doing /give @s structure_block and BOOM  - a mysterious purple and black block is in your inventory. You can use structure blocks to copy and paste structures of up to 16 chunks - 4x4 - in a square area. You can also export your builds as files, and place them in other worlds using Structure Blocks. Structure Blocks use the X, Y, Z, coordinate function, but the point 0 is always the block itself. You can copy one structure, and with a single structure block, place it millions of blocks away using Offset.

I learned this by myself, but there are plenty of online tutorials to help you with these blocks.
Double seating is camel-exclusive, and storage is exclusive to certain mounts with other lacking features. This creates a better balance rather than all mounts having similar features.

I don't think this would really work. For one thing, I think sleeping bags have already been considered and scrapped, and tents would be too big. Without elaboration on this idea, I don't quite see the purpose of this.
Yes! I would love to be able to go camping.

It would be cool to have more liquids, but they shouldn't add one if there isn't a good reason for it. I could see oil being cool. I think it should be shallower than water and lava, about as thick as top snow, (cause it would look kind of weird I feel otherwise. You could light it on fire, and all oil blocks touching it would ignite as well. This would be a good mechanic, since there is no way to quickly ignite a large area.
While i think this would be cool, what would be the purpose??

acid, similar to lava but has the flow distance ad speed of water, does less dmg, and doesn't burn, could be used in the nether for new biomes, or replacing things like basalt lava or sometimes there might be acid pools in caves, or single acid blocks in certain underground biomes just like how sometimes theres random lava blocks in the nether

You know how Mojang doesn’t want to add stuff that will make people playing the game think is cool/ok. like you can’t feed parrots a cookie because they don’t want people in real life to feed parrots cookies because cookies are poisonous to parrots. And they didn’t add sharks in the ocean update because they didn’t want kids playing it to hate sharks and want them dead irl.
So they probably wouldn’t add something bad for the environment when it’s burned
Bleach/acid good to change color wool or any other color block back to white, but can use as a weapon that causes extra damage to armor and players
The 16-colour palette is intentional, based on old-school video game palettes. New colours are highly unlikely.
Rose wool was actually in Minecraft Classic.
We have cyan already??
Or at least be able to dye them since they are terracotta, which can be dyed.

ALT IDEA

This concept involves a complete overhaul of the blacksmith bench. To start the menu would have a place for your tools, and 3 slots one shows the head of the tool, one she shaft, and one a blueprint icon.
 
With this players can customize tools with tips/blades and handle. blueprints may allow turning tools into a unique item. note each tool can only have one mod per slot.

Tips:

these are for example netherite coating on diamond. each one does something different.
Gold: increase enchant
iron: increases durability by 10%
Stone: Stone axes only changes the stone type.
copper: allows the tool to oxidize, showing age.
Wood: Bows/crossbows only increases range
Redstone: hitting redstone blocks activates them.
glow stone: tool glows when dropped.
 
Handle:
These slots allow one to increase durability by adding grips or increase range by adding sticks.
Sticks: increase range by 1 block but also slows swing speed.
Leather: flat 10% durability increase
spider web: flat 5% durability increase
phantom membrane: increases damage done at night by 2 hearts
wood: replaces wood with that type.
 
----------------------
Blueprints / Dusty Blueprints
 
unlike above idea: bluprints would come in two forms standard which can be used infinite times and dusty that is one time use. example of one bellow.
 
Rake
Base tool: Hoe
tip slot: 4 sticks
handle slot: NA
blueprint: rake or dusty rake
Item: rake, can plow or path a 3x1 area.
We don't need to completely change the weapon system. I want additions to the weapon system, but completely changing what we already have isn't a good idea.
As long as they're made from any material different than wood for balancing reasons, Yes please!
There won't be more colours to the 16-colour palette, but that's why there's other various blocks that aren't solid hues. Creativity is encouraged.
We already have boats
If it takes more blocks to build, can carry less players and no chest, than what is the point of this raft? please elaborate further.

Due to the bamboo raft having been announced at Minecraft Live, this probably won't happen. I wish they had done this instead though, instead of making it a boat skin.

I think that having it sink with a 2nd player or a chest doesn't make sense. It would be better to have its advantage over a boat be that it can carry more. It would be cool if you could place block on it.
Flowering vines should be its own species rather than of the existing flowers, like clematis, wisteria, cypress vine, morning glory...
A toned-down version of these concepts seem feasible.

Love the idea, though I think there should only be one blackberry (item) status and each growth of black berries should provide more berries. Also, bramble should be able to be tamed using shears like with glow berry vines, etc

This idea seems pretty well thought out, and unique. Rather than having 4 or 5 qualities of blackberries, maybe just have 1 type, but can be eaten in clusters of 4, and still retain your idea of, the better care of the bramble bush, the more they'll produce. 

The brambler mob sounds pretty neat, a bit vague, but I like the idea of him popping out when you didn't expect it. You should have to have a minimum amount of blackberries to tame him, and no guaranteed success, just like taming cats and wolves. He could be imbued with thorns I, II, or III depending on how well the bramble bush was cared for that he was converted from, and have a melee attack.

Let's delve into how you can actually care for the bramble bushes better, maybe they get too bushy and you need to use shears to prune them in order to maximize yield.

As for the actual hunger points restored, I can't say much about that because the relationship between saturation and hunger points is very confusing to me. Maybe just 2 points of hunger and a half a point of saturation per blackberry.  

I also like what the poster above me said, I just read it after I posted my thoughts lol. Maybe instead of feeding the brambler to tame it, it is tamed using shears, but the shears have to be used on the bramble bush before it turns into a brambler, otherwise any bramblers spawning will be permanently hostile. Bramblers could spawn when harvesting, as a small chance, but greater chances when the bramble bush is ill cared for.
ooh so you can eat to get more hunger, that would be useful for  gapples

These seem doable for seasonal biomes, like an autumn one where the trees have red orange or yellow leaves. Trees in the current snow biomes should turn white. Pink cherry blossom trees in its own grove biome, maybe a floral spring biome.
Hechas con ladrillos cocidos, un ladrillo al lado de otro en la mesa de crafteo, haría dos tejas.
I totally agree bro, why isnt this a thing in minecraft?
it can be so annoying when villagers take your bed
I posted something kind of similar to this. But just a usable bookshelf in general that only stores books, enchanted or regular. And shows it filling up
I loved your idea so I included it in my post!
The petals are only one colour, though, which should offer only pink dye.
Adding mossy and cracked variants of wood blocks would be cool.
There is an End Ore planned
Lapis does have its uses already: enchanting and crafting into blue dye. However, I do like the idea of using it to craft Enderite! Question: what color should Enderite be? Purple?
I think it would be epic
Great idea! Maybe as a variation on the already existing block of light, but you can set it to a negative value.

It wouldn't be slightly stronger, because diamond always must stay the most powerful material (and netherite is an upgrade/variation of it). It also couldn't act the same as diamond because then why not just get diamond instead of risking your life in the deep dark? Maybe the armour would have the same toughness as iron, but the same durability as diamond. It would also grant an extra ability, like being able to withstand distortion effects with a full set (such as blindness, darkness and nausea).

The problem is, because enchanted diamond gear is already found in the ancient cities, having shadow steel be weaker than the diamond wouldn't work. However the idea for an added ability sounds good, so maybe it cannot be enchanted. Instead, it could have a higher durability, and be more efficient than unenchanted or low level enchanted diamond gear.
Someone else suggested this would be like Minecraft + WingDings.
I think that would be in the Jungle Update for sure.
That would be very interesting if they add new structures to the game
I hope y'all like my idea! I just want to remember my partners in war crime ;-;
